title: What is this screen called? - Quora

response.answer_text: It looks like a photoshop collage, probably for an advertisement. It looks like a video editing timeline in the background, but the rolls have been copied and offset multiple times. In video editing software you would not have source (the girl) matted out over the top of the GUI. She would be in a window. She's also in a different gamma space. If this were a photograph of a monitor or screen grab there wouldn't be as much of a gamma difference between elements.  Gamma space difference is a clear indicator of a (poor) composite.

It is a cold cathode fluorescent backlit transreflective polymer film liquid crystal display if memory serves, but I guess that is not what you where looking for. It looks very much like an Eizo computer monitor for industrial applications (ultra long durability).
